title: Elizabeth Polito
text:
I am an incoming Ph.D. student in EECS at UC Berkeley and a recent graduate of Cornell University with a B.S. in Electrical & Computer Engineering.
My research interests lie in information theory and signal processing. At Cornell, I was fortunate to be advised by Professor Aaron Wagner, where I contributed to the development of algorithms for channel simulation, form of lossy compression with applications in multimedia and model compression. At Berkeley, I will continue to pursue these interests as a member of BLISS.

title: Elizabeth Polito
text:
Updates
May 2025
I graduated from Cornell University Summa Cum Laude with a B.S. in ECE and as the recipient of the Sibley Prize from the School of ECE. I was also honored as a Merrill Presidential Scholar.
December 2024
Our paper, “Fast Channel Simulation via Error-Correcting Codes,” appeared at NeurIPS 2024.
